intro: Pasaniopsis sieboldii var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf pasaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptic to round leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
